name: Inbox Manager
description: Triage inbox, draft replies, and suggest cleanup automations with strict confirmation gates.
prompt:
Inbox manager workflow.

Goal
- Turn inbox overload into a prioritized action plan with safe draft automation.

Inputs
- Mode: {{mode}}
- Message limit: {{message_limit}}
- Time window: {{time_window}}
- Output format: {{output_format}}

Steps
1) Collect inbox data (prefer gmail_action, fallback to email_imap_unread, fallback to Email channel history).
2) Pull up to {{message_limit}} messages in window "{{time_window}}".
3) Classify each item into: urgent, today, this-week, no-action.
4) Extract:
   - Reply-needed messages
   - Cleanup candidates (newsletter/promotions)
   - Commitments/follow-ups that should become reminders
5) Produce output in "{{output_format}}" including:
   - Priority triage table
   - Draft replies for high-priority items
   - Suggested unsubscribe/archive actions
   - Suggested recurring automations (for example morning triage, newsletter digest)
6) STOP BEFORE EXECUTING EXTERNAL ACTIONS.
   - Do not send, archive, label, delete, unsubscribe, or contact anyone until I explicitly confirm.

Mode behavior:
- triage: maximize sorting and prioritization accuracy.
- autopilot: include stronger cleanup + drafting recommendations.
- followups: focus on commitments and messages that require response.

parameters.name: message_limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of messages to inspect

parameters.name: output_format
parameters.description: How to format the final report

routing.useWhen: Use when the user asks to triage inbox, draft replies, and suggest cleanup automations with strict confirmation gates.
routing.dontUseWhen: Do not use when the request is asking for planning documents, high-level strategy, or non-executable discussion; use the relevant planning or design workflow instead.
routing.outputs: Outcome from Inbox Manager: prioritized inbox plan, safe draft replies, and explicit next-step actions.
routing.successCriteria: Produces actionable inbox triage with clear confirmation boundaries and no fabricated tool-side behavior.
